title: The adoption process is challenging for any couple, and even more so for those in the military. But our struggle was worth it
text:
I’m not going to pretend that any of this was easy. We had to fill in paperwork where we were asked what we couldn't handle with an adopted child. There's a list of various issues and you're told to tick what you don't think you could deal with. There are questions about things like the age of the child, whether you’ll accept sibling groups, ethnicity and disabilities.

With every tick, I thought: “How many children have I just said no to? How many have I written off?”’ Marking that first tick was the hardest thing I have ever done - tougher than anything I have done in the Army.

I found out that I was adopted when I was 11. My wife Stacey and I knew that there were so many children out there,...
description: I’m not going to pretend that any of this was easy.
